name: Centennial Olympic Park
description: Centennial Olympic park is a 21 acre park located in downtown Atlanta. It was built for the 1996 Olympics. The park is a popular spot for a number of festivals and concerts. It is surrounded on all sides by a number of Atlanta attractions including the CNN Center & Phillips Arena, the Georgia Aquarium, The National Center for Civil and Human Rights, The World of Coca Cola, and Skyview Atlanta (Ferris Wheel).
parking: Paid parking available in a number of lots and decks around the park. Expect to pay at least $10 or more when there is an event going on in the park or at Philips arena.
